description: If you're using jest fake timers make sure you use modern timers. If you are using jest@26/27 see: https://github.com/testing-library/dom-testing-library/releases/tag/v8.0.0 If you are using jest@28 see: https://jestjs.io/docs/28.0/upgrading-to-jest28#faketimers

<script />, <style /> and comment nodes are now ignored by default in prettyDOM .If you whish to return to the old behavior, use a custom filterNode function. In this case prettyDOM(element, { filterNode: () => true }).
Node 10 is no longer supported. Node >=12 is now required.
The timeout in waitFor(callback, { interval, timeout } ) now uses the same clock as interval. Previously timeout was always using the real clock while interval was using the global clock.
